â   â
{{Campaignbox Syrian uprising}}
 
The '''Siege of Hama''',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/country-files_156/syria_295/france-and-syria_6018/political-relations_6414/syria-siege-of-hama-05.07.11_15946.html |title=France-Diplomatie |publisher=Diplomatie.gouv.fr |date= |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> also known as the '''Hama Blockade'''<ref>{{cite web|author=<!--[if IE 6]> <![endif]--> |url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/07/07/156475.html |title=Syrian protesters demand end of Hama blockade |publisher=Alarabiya.net |date=2011-07-07 |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> is a major arena of the [[2011 Syrian uprising]] against [[Syria]]n president [[Bashar al-Assad]]. The city of [[Hama]] engaged in violence since 3 June 2011, when tens of thousands of demonstrators took to the streets to express their opposition to the government. They were targeted by the secret police and military forces, and more than 50 people were killed and hundreds injured.<ref name=autogenerated2 /> On 1 July, with more than 400,000 protestors, Hama witnessed the largest demonstration against Bashar al-Assad.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13988701 |title=BBC News - Syria: 'Hundreds of thousands' join anti-Assad protests |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2011-07-01 |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> Two days later, Syrian tanks deployed at Hama,<ref name=autogenerated5>{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/07/03/us-syria-hama-idUSTRE7620XE20110703 |title=Syrian tanks deploy at Hama after large protest |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> in an operation that led to more than 20 civilians killed by the Syrian security forces and two rape cases were witnessed.<ref name=autogenerated4 />
The '''Siege of Hama''',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/country-files_156/syria_295/france-and-syria_6018/political-relations_6414/syria-siege-of-hama-05.07.11_15946.html |title=France-Diplomatie |publisher=Diplomatie.gouv.fr |date= |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> also known as the '''Hama Blockade'''<ref>{{cite web|author=<!--[if IE 6]> <![endif]--> |url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/07/07/156475.html |title=Syrian protesters demand end of Hama blockade |publisher=Alarabiya.net |date=2011-07-07 |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> is a major arena of the [[2011 Syrian uprising]] against [[Syria]]n president [[Bashar al-Assad]]. The city of [[Hama]] engaged in violence since 3 June 2011, when tens of thousands of demonstrators took to the streets to express their opposition to the government. They were targeted by the secret police and military forces, and more than 50 people were killed and hundreds injured.<ref name=autogenerated2 /> On 1 July, with more than 400,000 protestors, Hama witnessed the largest demonstration against Bashar al-Assad.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13988701 |title=BBC News - Syria: 'Hundreds of thousands' join anti-Assad protests |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2011-07-01 |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> Two days later, Syrian tanks deployed at Hama,<ref name=autogenerated5>{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/07/03/us-syria-hama-idUSTRE7620XE20110703 |title=Syrian tanks deploy at Hama after large protest |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2011-08-03}}</ref> in an operation that led to more than 20 civilians killed by the Syrian security forces and two rape cases were witnessed.<ref name=autogenerated4 />

==Ramadan massacre==
==Ramadan massacre==
  +
{{Campaignbox Syrian uprising}}
The '''Ramadan massacre''' which occurred on 31 July 2011, was a major escalation, focused primarily in the city of [[Hama]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=38035 |title=At least 150 die in what Syrians dub âRamadan Massacreâ |publisher=Bikya Masr |accessdate=1 August 2011}}</ref>
The '''Ramadan massacre''' which occurred on 31 July 2011, was a major escalation, focused primarily in the city of [[Hama]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=38035 |title=At least 150 die in what Syrians dub âRamadan Massacreâ |publisher=Bikya Masr |accessdate=1 August 2011}}</ref>
